items.sentence: Tom buttoned up his shirt and then put on his tie.
If you want to change your mind, it\'s OK with me.
I want you to have opportunities that I never had.
What makes you think that I want to be left alone?
What was your favorite book when you were a child?
Don\'t you think you\'ll ever move back to Boston?
Tom keeps an extra tie in his desk drawer at work.
Tom says that learning a foreign language is hard.
I\'ve already told Tom what he should say to Mary.
I\'ve already told Tom what to bring to the party.
